Hi,

I am trying to do the following:

* have an existing TestCase that has testXXX() methods
* have an XML file that defines multiple datasets for each testXXX() 
method  
* have a mechanism (JTestCase) to parse through XML and tie it to a 
JUnit testXXX() method.
* have a single setUp and tearDown routine for each testXXX() method 
in my test class

I need to be able to run a single testXXX() method using the 
different datasets for that testXXX() in my XML file.  This testXXX
() can run more than one time depending on how much data is defined 
for it in the XML file.  Each dataset test run would need to call 
the setUp and tearDown routine.

Has anyone ever tried to do something similar?  If so, I would 
really appreciate some insight.  My thinking is that perhaps I could 
create a TestSuite for each testXXX() method and each dataset for 
that testXXX() method would be added to the TestSuite:

TestSuite methodSuite = new TestSuite();
// the following line would be called as many times as there are
// datasets for the testXXX method in the XML file
methodSuite.addTest(TestSuite.createTest(existingTestCase.getClass
(), "testXXX");

My problem is that how can I execute another setUp in methodSuite 
that would allow me to create perhaps a Properties or Hashtable of 
data tied to each testXXX dataset being added?  Is there a way to 
call a setUp() in a TestSuite that would execute for each Test added 
to it AND still call the setUp for the Test as defined in the 
TestCase class?

Thanks,
Jacqui
